description: From Latin infinitesimus, from infinitus (“infinite”) + -esimus, as in centesimus (“hundredth”).

adjectives.description: infinitesimal (comparative more infinitesimal, superlative most infinitesimal)

entries.meaning: Incalculably, exceedingly, or immeasurably minute; vanishingly small.
examples: Do you ever get the feeling that you are but an infinitesimal speck, swallowed by the vastness of the universe and beyond?

entries.meaning: (mathematics) Of or pertaining to values that approach zero as a limit.
(mathematics) A non-zero quantity whose magnitude is smaller than any positive number (by definition it is not a real number).
